metadata.Title: CVE-2013-3561 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Multiple integer overflows in Wireshark 1.8.x before 1.8.7 allow remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (loop or application crash) via amalformed packet, related to a crash of the Websocket dissector, aninfinite loop in the MySQL dissector, and a large loop in the ETCHdissector.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-3561` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.10.6-1
libwireshark3 - 1.10.6-1
libwiretap3 - 1.10.6-1
libwsutil3 - 1.10.6-1
tshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark-common - 1.10.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.6-1').
